source: Homer ( Ὅμηρος [ hómɛːros ] , Hómēros ) is the name ascribed by the ancient Greeks to the author of the Iliad and the Odyssey , two epic poems which are the central works of ancient Greek literature . The Thicket is an mystery/suspense novel written by American author Joe R. Lansdale .
summary:
The passage provides information about two distinct works:

1. The Iliad and the Odyssey: These are epic poems that are central to ancient Greek literature. They were attributed to a Greek author named Homer.

2. The Thicket: This is a mystery/suspense novel written by American author Joe R. Lansdale. The passage does not provide any details about the content of this novel.
